p: Saponins fraction of C. europaea extracts induced an important inhibited effect on both MDA-MB-231 ( Figure 8) and MCF cell lines ( Figure 9) even with the lowest concentration (1.562 μg/ml). Saponins clearly exhibited significant antiproliferative activity on both cell lines, with IC 50 values of 5.097 μg/ml and 4.195 μg/ml on MCF7 and MDA-MB-231 cell lines, respectively. Flavonoids were ineffective with the tested range of concentrations. There was no significant difference between the IC 50 values of saponin fractions on MCF7 no MDA-MB-231 ( p > 0.05).
